channel.title: Research on Office of Water Programs
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Office of Water Programs

item.title: Tod Granicher
item.description: Environmental Specialist Office of Water Programs, California State University, Sacramento, 2004–present Sampling and analytical quality assurance/control compliance Sample collection and analytical data methodology and interpretation Data review, storage, and retrieval Monitoring methodology and analytical data review OWP Water Quality Laboratory management Caltrans stormwater and monitoring equipment database management Software development for data retrieval and data management Project Manager Sequoia Analytical Laboratories/Severn-Trent Laboratories, San Francisco, 1991–2003 Analytical project design for one of the world’s largest environmental laboratory networks Customized sample-collection and analytical strategy development based on operational, contractual, and regulatory requirements of clients Technical consulting for clients across a wide multidisciplinary spectrum Project-specific method development in accordance with federal and state methodology and laboratory SOP Laboratory QA/QC compliance Laboratory data report design and production Client-directed laboratory services interpretation and training for non-experts Professional Interests Analytical methodology and instrumentation; data quality control; environmental sample collection equipment and practices; database design, implementation, maintenance, and security

item.title: Erosion
